Yes.

@the_soul wrote:

Make the sendMessage method static as you’re calling it from another class.

item.title: Non-static error
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Heres my code

public void modern() { if (interfaceId == 192 && buttonId == 0) { //Entity.teleport(3222, 3219, 0); ActionSender.sendMessage("Magic Test"); }

Heres the error

Compiling Main src\com\rs2hd\model\Magic.java:29: non-static method sendMessage(java.lang.Strin g) cannot be referenced from a static context ActionSender.sendMessage("Magic Test"); ^ 1 error

I haven’t declared anything as static, why would I get that error?

Read full topic
